phrase.item: I am in love with the sight of you, allow me to see you, Mawlo.
Mawlo: Imam, Ismaili Muslims call their imam Mawlo.
I wish to see you a hundred times, allow me to see you, Mawlo.
A child in his childhood is [like] a king, he doesn't care about anyone.
When he grows up, night and day he tells you, allow me to see you, Mawlo.
On the ground [there are] flowers and greens, all of them desire to hear your footsteps.
??? begging and wailing, allow me to see you, Mawlo.
On the ground is a flower and in the air a nightingale, in the steppe a tulip, and in the garden [a type of bird].
There are many mutes [who] tell you, many [people] without legs ask you, allow me to see you, Mawlo.
At the beginning I listen to the sound of birds.
It calls your name and says, allow me to see you, Mawlo.
Ignorant Mirek in the Wukh country, dervish of your name, Mawlo.
He met you, and he says to you, allow me to see you, Mawlo.
